Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Andy? [Andy starts boombox and begins singing 'The Ballad of Sweeney Todd']

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes! [as other costumed actors come in and join Andy in song]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Did you write this?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Who did?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Steven Sondheim.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Who is he? [rest of Sweeney Todd cast enters and continues singing]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What the hell is happening?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We're the cast of Sweeney Todd:

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [cheers loudly after cast finishes singing song] That was amazing! That was awesome! I auditioned for this. When did the cast list go up?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Like a month ago.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? They didn't call me. Who am I playing? ...Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Two comps. For my lady and her Gabe. It's closing night. Tomorrow we have to give the theater over to the Scranton's Miss Fitness pageant.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I am so excited. But I just need one. Gabe can't come. Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What? That's awful. Everyone's gonna miss that guy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Gabe is not coming, which is huge because my plan is to make Erin fall back in love with me tonight. Women cannot resist a man singing show tunes. It's so powerful, even a lot of men can't resist a man singing show tunes.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, who else is going?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Everyone.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Gabe seemed to think no one was going.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What kind of terrible rumor monger is Gabe? He is woefully misinformed, all right? Excuse me, clink, clink, clink, clink, everybody. You're all coming to my show tonight, right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Andy, what time's the show?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: 8pm sharp.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How long is it?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hour forty-five.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nope, can't make it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They say that no one can take your pride, but the people who cast Andy's play, they took mine.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Jim, Pam, you guys are in, right?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, we wanted to, but our sitter just fell through. I'm really sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, no, thank you. Last time I went to the theater, a man dressed as a cat sat on my lap.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It would mean so much to me if you came to my show tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I can't Andy, it's too hard. That's-I put everything I had into that audition. Do you understand that?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: If it makes you feel any better, no one who auditioned for the part of Sweeney Todd got that part. They had to bring in a ringer.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This guy's like world-class. You should not feel bad. I'm asking you thespian to thespian. Will you please be the bigger man and come to my show?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I wish I could, Andy, but I can't. I have plans that night. I'm going to see a friend in a play called Sweeney Todd. You're that friend. I'm going to see your play.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Noishe!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And scene.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Listen, I would like you to take me to Andy's play tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Please, waste of time. You know what? Let's just knock this out right now. Disrobe.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Angela? Don't like her anymore. Not attracted to her anymore. Just contractually obligated to make a baby with her.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Give me the punch card.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No. If you want to punch the punch card, you have to take me to the show.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That is not in the contract.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Well, there's a lot of gray area in that clause. Do you want to re-mediate?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Alright, fine. I'll go to your little show, but I'm not wearing a cape.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Dwight and I have a contractual agreement to procreate five times, plain and simple. And should he develop feelings for me, well, that would be permissible under item 7C, clause 2, so I would not object. [faint smile]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, how are those salads?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's my own fault-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: My parents used to scramble to find babysitters so they could take my younger brother to do stuff. I understand how hard it can be. I just-tonight, if you could...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We'll keep looking.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I mean, who knows? Maybe I have a niece my family never told me about.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh my gosh, that would be amazing.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: For a lot of reasons.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, I know. Neiche!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, hey guys.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: You brought balloons to a play?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I did, because I am being the bigger man, and balloons are bigger than flowers.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It's nice, like Up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Usher
Quote.Text: Excuse me, are you the guy who did an entire Law & Order episode for his audition?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Guys?

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Hey! Andy!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You all made it, thank you so much.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You should actually thank Erin, she's the one who agreed to babysit.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: She's babysitting?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I really wanted to see Andy's play, because he's so, so talented. But I've been trying to get in the babysitting game forever. The thirteen-year-olds in this town have a complete monopoly. It's almost like a babysitters club.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I understand. This is, like, huge opportunity for her.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [trying to stuff balloons below the seats] This is ridiculous. You'd think they'd discourage people from bringing in balloons.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey, I think this guy playing Sweeney Todd is my plumber.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, Darryl. This guy's a world-class actor. He doesn't daylight as your plumber.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No, it's my plumber. Says so in his bio. Apparently the director discovered him doing karaoke. It's his first play. He didn't even audition.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are you kidding me?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Shhh. If we don't listen to the overture, we won't recognize the musical themes when they come back later.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, I'm sorry. God.

Quote.Speaker: Usher
Quote.Text: Excuse me, I think you may be in the wrong seats. [Jim and Pam move a few rows back, next to Michael]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Ooooh!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [whispering to man sitting beside him] I work with that guy.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [after taking her gum out] Ugh! There's gum on the seat and now it's on my work skirt. I have to go change.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Too bad I'm not gonna explain anything that you miss.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh, Dwight, just move.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [whispering to man sitting beside him] His name's Andy. He's a terrible salesman.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What time is it? [Ryan pulls up a large analog clock on his iPad]

Quote.Speaker: Shelby
Quote.Text: Michael! Shelby Thomas Weemes, the director.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Shelby
Quote.Text: I promise you that if you keep auditioning with similar gusto...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Shelby
Quote.Text: We are going to find a production with a role for Michael Scott.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Shelby
Quote.Text: Yes?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Shelby
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Shelby
Quote.Text: Enjoy the second act.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You enjoy the second act.

Quote.Speaker: Shelby
Quote.Text: Have a refreshment.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you. You, too. [steals a bottle of wine from the bar]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Come on, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why are you dressed like a seed catalogue model?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: These are just my dirty old gardening clothes. They were all that I had in my car.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, Erin, it's Pam. How ya doing? No, no, don't put Cece on the phone, because she can't talk yet. Okay. No, I was just calling to see how everything's going. Yeah? Yeah? It's good? The play? The play is kind of great. I mean, it's fun to hear Andy sing in the appropriate setting. Now, he's really sorry you couldn't make it, too. Yeah. So thank you so much, again. We're having a great time. Oh, they're flashing the lights so we should go in. Thanks. Bye. Okay, so we called. And everything's fine!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Everything's fine.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We can relax.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We can relax. Let's get our Sweeney on.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [seeing Michael drink from wine bottle] Michael! [bottle gets passed around by Darryl, Meredith and Kevin]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Just checking my e-mails. See if I got any last-minute "break a legs" or "I still love you" type texts. Doesn't look like I got anything. Maybe on my Facebook wall.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [on cell phone] Unfortunately, in this ham-fisted production of Sweeney Todd, the real terror comes from the vocal performances. New paragraph.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Mr. Todd! Mr. Todd! I found her!

Quote.Speaker: Sweeney Todd
Quote.Text: You found Johanna.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That monster of a judge has locked her-[cell phone chiming]. Locked her away. [phone continues ringing]

Quote.Speaker: Sweeney Todd
Quote.Text: There's a little bird fluttering around. Do hope it ceases chirping. [audience laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How is that funny?

Quote.Speaker: Sweeney Todd
Quote.Text: The bird continues to call. Someone please turn off your... bird. Oh, for the love-turn your phone off! There are signs!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, it appears the bird was in mine own pocket this whole time. He's gone to sleep now, I've closed his beak. [Michael laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Sweeney Todd
Quote.Text: What is the news of my darling daughter Johanna?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [text message chime] You know what? Let me just double check, that bird... Okay, good. It's off. I mean, silenced. I silenced it by killing it. I've killed it! I'm a murderer! Just like you, Sweeney Todd. See, it all connects. Not that I know you're a murderer. My character doesn't know that yet. But I'm suspicious, because of all the razors that you have laying around. And you spend time alone. But you're a barber, so that's legit. So there's that. But...

Quote.Speaker: Sweeney Todd
Quote.Text: [yelling] Where is Johanna?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: A madhouse.

Quote.Speaker: Sweeney Todd
Quote.Text: A madhouse?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes, a madhouse.

Quote.Speaker: Sweeney Todd
Quote.Text: A madhouse? Johanna is as good as rescued. Where do you suppose all the wig makes of London go to obtain their human hair? [Michael tips over wine bottle, which noisily rolls down the theater, and accidentally lets go of balloons]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Do you think... [bottle rolling] so you think... [bottle rolling, clanking]

Quote.Speaker: Sweeney Todd
Quote.Text: Fogg's Asylum , why not? [balloon pops, Kelly screams and baby starts crying]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sounds like Cece.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, I think everybody just needs to relax.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [sees Erin holding Cece] Oh, my God! Go, go!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, my God.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [excited] That's really irresponsible of Erin. She's a terrible babysitter.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I just didn't think that you guys were gonna see us. We were just gonna stop by and get some ice cream and then go home.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, this was pretty simple-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Why are you here?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [overlapping with Pam] Really, all you had to do was play with her for, like, 30 minutes and then put her to bed.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What possible explanation could you have for possibly being here? I don't... you know, babies shouldn't have ice cream, by the way.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I'm sorry. I just really wanted to see Andy. You guys made it sound so unmissable, and you set me up with a car seat and everything.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, the car seat was to take her to the hospital, or...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, no, why would I take her to the hospital?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You know what? It doesn't matter. It doesn't matter.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Why don't I just take her home and let you guys finish, and then you should stay out as late as you want.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, we're good. Thank you, though.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Okay. Alright, bye Cece.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright, well, we're never leaving the house again.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Not together!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [during curtain call for Sweeney Todd] Boo! Boo!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: That was more horrifying than Nunsense.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: All that singing got in the way of some perfectly good murders.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Where's my car? Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmm! Fruit is so much better when it's dried. I've already eaten, like, 30 apricots.

Quote.Speaker: Sweeney Todd
Quote.Text: Darryl?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Sweeney Todd
Quote.Text: Didn't know you were gonna be here. How's the toilet?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Silent. Look, congratulations.

Quote.Speaker: Sweeney Todd
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I had no idea. This plumber has pipes!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, good job. Well done.

Quote.Speaker: Sweeney Todd
Quote.Text: You're the guy who booed me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hmm? No, there were a lot of people booing you. I wasn't one of em.

Quote.Speaker: Sweeney Todd
Quote.Text: No, I saw you, and you were the only one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Get your eyes checked, chucklehead.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Be cool, Michael. I saw this guy kill a bunch of people. Good work.

Quote.Speaker: Sweeney Todd
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You didn't have to boo him.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, he was getting a lot of applause, and I just didn't think it was indicative of how people were really feeling.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: How would you like it if we booed you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That would never happen.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Boo! Boo!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. I appreciate the feedback.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Boo! Boo!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't like that at all.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Are you ready?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yes. Oh, I'm so scared! Okay, kill me! Just kill me! Kill me!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [pretends to slit her throat] Ah! Blood everywhere.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, no. I'm so glad we're hanging out again outside of work.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, me, too.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Okay, I kill you now.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: All right, let's do this.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, actually, Dwight, I didn't realize how far this walk was, and I-I'm exhausted.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's okay, I smell.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no. I think I just want to go home, but it's okay. This can count as one of your times.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no, no. Contractually we're obligated to have sex.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Well, I won't tell if you don't.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I will tell. I will tell the mediator. What-what are you... [Angela reaches into his pocket] Ok. Oh, was that in the way? Get rid of it. [Angela pulls out hole-punch and punches the card]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Good night, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good night.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: These would have been your seats. Best seats in the house. Lots of people think it would be the front row, but actually, right here, this is where the speakers converge, and the sound just, like, nails you right here.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: This is awesome. [cell phone rings] Sorry. Hi, Gabe. Yeah, I just stopped by Andy's cast party to say hi to everyone. Oh, sure, I can pick you up some soup. What do you want? That's broth, Gabe. Okay, I-I'll see you soup. [hangs up] Okay, I have to go. Thank you so much. This is so much fun, and I'm really sorry that I missed your play, but next time I'll be there. Or here. Right here, I promise.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: See you later.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [attempting to move car seat] It's like The Hurt Locker!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: This night was a disaster.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, it was not a disaster. It was weird, but it wasn't a disaster. I think we have, like, a gift bottle of Irish cream.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We could put that in orange juice.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Get it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Let's get our juice on.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Found him!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, what's going on here? Post-show blues?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, I guess you could say that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I get those every day after work.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Your show was really great, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Interesting subject matter. I'm surprised you pulled it off.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It was like amateur hour.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It was an amateur production, technically.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oscar. Enough with the sass, please. God! What is wrong with you? Andy, listen to me. Look me in the eye. I thought that you were awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Stop just saying that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am not just saying that. You can trust that I am telling you the truth. I booed someone tonight. I have no filter. And if I thought you were terrible, I would have booed. And if I thought you had done a better job, I would be saying nicer things right now. But I thought that you were exactly awesome. No better, no worse.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank you. That feels good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I did not say that to make you feel good. I just said it. Total integrity.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Andy, sing us another song.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thanks, but I feel like a loner right now.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, come on, Andy, you were the highlight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on, Andy, seriously.

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Andy! Andy! Andy! Andy! Andy!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay, all right, all right, all right.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [sings Macy Gray's "I Try" and everyone joins in]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: In the criminal justice system, the people are defended by two separate but equally important groups, the police who investigate the crimes and the district attorneys who prosecute the offenders. These are their stories. Kun-kun! [imitates vacuum cleaner] I'm just a cleaning lady. Aah! A dead body. He wrapped his belt around his own neck. It looks like a classic case of autoerotic asphyxiation. Yeah, looks like everyone's tightening their belts in this economy. [humming theme music] Last time you saw the victim, was he happy? Last time I saw this John, he was-he wasn't a victim, if you know what I'm talkin about.

Quote.Speaker: Shelby
Quote.Text: Thanks you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, that was- I'm just getting into the first act.
